abstract_sentences.1: Recurrent neural networks (RNNs) have shown promising performance for language modeling.
abstract_sentences.2: However, traditional training of RNNs using back-propagation through time often suffers from overfitting.
abstract_sentences.3: One reason for this is that stochastic optimization (used for large training sets) does not provide good estimates of model uncertainty.
abstract_sentences.4: This paper leverages recent advances in stochastic gradient Markov Chain Monte Carlo (also appropriate for large training sets) to learn weight uncertainty in RNNs.
abstract_sentences.5: It yields a principled Bayesian learning algorithm, adding gradient noise during training (enhancing exploration of the model-parameter space) and model averaging when testing.
abstract_sentences.6: Extensive experiments on various RNN models and across a broad range of applications demonstrate the superiority of the proposed approach relative to stochastic optimization.

body_sentences.2: Recently, recurrent neural networks (RNNs) have shown promising performance on this task (Mikolov et al., 2010; Sutskever et al., 2011).
body_sentences.3: RNNs with Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) units (Hochreiter and Schmidhuber, 1997) have emerged as a popular architecture, due to their representational power and effectiveness at capturing long-term dependencies.

body_sentences.6: timization methods such as stochastic gradient descent (SGD) (Robbins and Monro, 1951); stochastic methods of this type are particularly important for training with large data sets.
body_sentences.7: However, this approach often provides a maximum a posteriori (MAP) estimate of model parameters.
body_sentences.8: The MAP solution is a single point estimate, ignoring weight uncertainty (Blundell et al., 2015; HernándezLobato and Adams, 2015).
body_sentences.9: Natural language often exhibits significant variability, and hence such a point estimate may make over-confident predictions on test data.
body_sentences.10: To alleviate overfitting RNNs, good regularization is known as a key factor to successful applications.
body_sentences.11: In the neural network literature, Bayesian learning has been proposed as a principled method to impose regularization and incorporate model uncertainty (MacKay, 1992; Neal, 1995), by imposing prior distributions on model parameters.
body_sentences.12: Due to the intractability of posterior distributions in neural networks, Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC) (Neal, 1995) has been used to provide sample-based approximations to the true posterior.
body_sentences.13: Despite the elegant theoretical property of asymptotic convergence to the true posterior, HMC and other conventional Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods are not scalable to large training sets.
body_sentences.14: This paper seeks to scale up Bayesian learning of RNNs to meet the challenge of the increasing amount of “big” sequential data in natural language processing, leveraging recent advances in stochastic gradient Markov Chain Monte Carlo (SG-MCMC) algorithms (Welling and Teh, 2011; Chen et al., 2014; Ding et al., 2014; Li et al., 2016a,b).
body_sentences.15: Specifically, instead of training a single network, SG-MCMC is employed to train an ensemble of networks, where each network has its parameters drawn from a shared posterior distribution.
body_sentences.16:

body_sentences.17: This simple procedure has the following salutary properties for training neural networks: (i) When training, the injected noise encourages model-parameter trajectories to better explore the parameter space.
body_sentences.18: This procedure was also empirically found effective in Neelakantan et al.
body_sentences.20: (ii) Model averaging when testing alleviates overfitting and hence improves generalization, transferring uncertainty in the learned model parameters to subsequent prediction.
body_sentences.21: (iii) In theory, both asymptotic and non-asymptotic consistency properties of SG-MCMC methods in posterior estimation have been recently established to guarantee convergence (Chen et al., 2015a; Teh et al., 2016).
body_sentences.22: (iv) SG-MCMC is scalable; it shares the same level of computational cost as SGD in training, by only requiring the evaluation of gradients on a small mini-batch.
body_sentences.23: To the authors’ knowledge, RNN training using SG-MCMC has not been investigated previously, and is a contribution of this paper.
body_sentences.24: We also perform extensive experiments on several natural language processing tasks, demonstrating the effectiveness of SG-MCMC for RNNs, including character/word-level language modeling, image captioning and sentence classification.
body_sentences.25: 2 Related Work  Several scalable Bayesian learning methods have been proposed recently for neural networks.
body_sentences.26:
These come in two broad categories: stochastic variational inference (Graves, 2011; Blundell et al., 2015; Hernández-Lobato and Adams, 2015) and
SG-MCMC methods (Korattikara et al., 2015; Li et al., 2016a).
body_sentences.27: While prior work focuses on feed-forward neural networks, there has been little if any research reported for RNNs using SGMCMC.
body_sentences.28: Dropout (Hinton et al., 2012; Srivastava et al., 2014) is a commonly used regularization method for training neural networks.
body_sentences.29: Recently, several works have studied how to apply dropout to RNNs (Pachitariu and Sahani, 2013; Bayer et al., 2013; Pham et al., 2014; Zaremba et al., 2014; Bluche et al., 2015; Moon et al., 2015; Semeniuta et al., 2016; Gal and Ghahramani, 2016b).
body_sentences.30: Among them, naive dropout (Zaremba et al., 2014) can impose weight uncertainty only on encoding weights (those that connect input to hidden units) and decoding weights (those that connect hidden units to output), but not the recurrent weights (those that connect consecutive hidden states).
body_sentences.31: It has been concluded that noise added in the recurrent connections leads to model instabilities, hence disrupting the RNN’s ability to model sequences.
body_sentences.32: Dropout has been recently shown to be a variational approximation technique in Bayesian learning (Gal and Ghahramani, 2016a; Kingma et al., 2015).
body_sentences.33: Based on this, (Gal and Ghahramani, 2016b) proposed a new variant of dropout that can be successfully applied to recurrent layers, where the same dropout masks are shared along time for encoding, decoding and recurrent weights, respectively.
body_sentences.34: Alternatively, we focus on SG-MCMC, which can be viewed as the Bayesian interpretation of dropout from the perspective of posterior sampling (Li et al., 2016c); this also allows imposition of model uncertainty on recurrent layers, enhancing performance.

body_sentences.53: 3.2 RNN Architectures  The transition function H(·) can be implemented with a gated activation function, such as Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) (Hochreiter and Schmidhuber, 1997) or a Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) (Cho et al., 2014).
body_sentences.54: Both the LSTM and GRU have been proposed to address the issue of learning long-term sequential dependencies.
body_sentences.55: Long Short-Term Memory The LSTM architecture addresses the problem of learning longterm dependencies by introducing a memory cell, that is able to preserve the state over long periods of time.
body_sentences.56: Specifically, each LSTM unit has a cell containing a state ct at time t. This cell can be viewed as a memory unit.
body_sentences.57: Reading or writing the cell is controlled through sigmoid gates: input gate it, forget gate ft, and output gate ot.

body_sentences.104: pSGLD Preconditioned SGLD (pSGLD) (Li et al., 2016a) was proposed recently to improve the mixing of SGLD.

body_sentences.226: 6 Conclusion  We propose a scalable Bayesian learning framework using SG-MCMC, to model weight uncertainty in recurrent neural networks.
body_sentences.227: The learning framework is tested on several tasks, including language models, image caption generation and sentence classification.
body_sentences.228: Our algorithm outperforms stochastic optimization algorithms, indicating the importance of learning weight uncertainty in recurrent neural networks.
body_sentences.229: Our algorithm requires little additional computational overhead in training, and multiple times of forward-passing for model averaging in testing.
